result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter B Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay restitution directly to Clerk of Courts

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Defendant shall submit to random observed testing for the presence of alcohol. 
Defendant shall present himself, sober, to Platteville PD, within the first 30 days of probation to apologize for this incident.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter B Hamilton

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Peter B Hamilton in court, in custody at Grant County Jail. Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant will be pleading to the charge. State recommends probation for 2 years with the following conditions: to pay restitution, maintain absolute sobriety, testing for the presence of alcohol, and court costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty to charge. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of charge. State heard. Attorney Bartelt heard. Defendant does not wish to be heard on sentencing. Court heard and orders 2 years probation with the following conditions: restitution, to have such assessment, treatment, programming, and counseling that DOC deems appropriate, maintain absolute sobriety, not to possess or consume any alcohol, submit to random observed testing for the presence of alcohol, DNA, to present self to Platteville PD, sober, within the first 30 days of probation, to apologize for this incident, and court waives court costs. 11 days credit if revoked.
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Status continued.
Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases continued for possible global resolution. Status set.
Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any intoxicants.
Defendant shall submit to testing upon request from law enforcement, court, or designee.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Peter A. Bartelt for Peter B Hamilton appeared by phone, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. State heard on bond and requests signature bond and not to consume any alcohol. Attorney Bartelt does not object. Court orders $1000 signature bond and defendant shall not possess or consume intoxicants, and to submit to testing upon request. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Court sets status date.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton not in court, Attorney Peter A. Bartelt for Peter B Hamilton appeared in court, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Court authorizes warrant for his non appearance.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Lisa McDougal appeared by phone for defendant, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant qualifies for SPD. State requests signature bond. Court sets bond at $1000 signature. Arraignment set.
Arraignment scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
